body:
A sync would mirror A to B and clean up anything needed.

What isn't happening in that scenario that you are asking for? i can't figure out why another flag is needed.

Agree a sync should do it, but for whatever reason it hasn't always (removed old versions, especially if renamed).  So a 'reverse' sync (cleanup) would be good.

Manually cleaning isn't an option at the size of the stored data.


—- 
Via iPad. Hopefully with not too many typos. 


> On 22. Aug 2022, at 16.19, Animosity ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> A sync would mirror A to B and clean up anything needed.
> 
> What isn't happening in that scenario that you are asking for? i can't figure out why another flag is needed.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.

It already does that so not sure why another command/flag would be needed.

If it's not, you'd have to share a log/etc to answer the question of why as you'd have found a bug perhaps.

As I wrote, that is the problem. It is pointless saying I've found X now in
the destination (originally called Y) when the change can be months or
longer ago (no way to tell).

I'm viewing this a bit like a smart disk check. It might be picking
everything up but something is slipping up. Even if it was due to an old
i/o error or old bug (am guessing).

You know it when you see it, e.g.

(folder names)
Source:
Dog Pictures

Remote:
Dog Pictures
Dog Pictures [INCOMPLETE]

And "Dog Pictures [INCOMPLETE]" is a part version, since renamed and
correctly synced as "Dog Pictures". [INCOMPLETE] is a correct part of the
directory name.


So anything that you can say EXAMINE REMOTE and flag/delete from REMOTE
anything that is not in the SOURCE is desirable.

See the problem in showing logs... and with over 50Tb of material even
thinking "delete destination, sync again" ain't going to be practical.




On Mon, 22 Aug 2022 at 16:31, Animosity ***@***.***> wrote:

> It already does that so not sure why another command/flag would be needed.
>
> If it's not, you'd have to share a log/etc to answer the question of why
> as you'd have found a bug perhaps.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6392#issuecomment-1222367871>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABV5MAGSQ7GU7N3RXNECXK3V2N6K3ANCNFSM57HQN6UQ>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

That already exists as you can do --dry-run to see what will happen.

If you re-run a sync, it does the whole remote every time as that's how sync works.

A is mirrored to B.

I am synching every day so no need to dry run. All I can be certain is that
OLD stuff is being retained on destination. Even if sporadically rather
than every file that is renamed, which would suggest a bug, and I could
replicate).

So we are going round in circles. What is needed is a B to A check even if
it logs or deletes. I've not found a way to force a B to A check.


On Mon, 22 Aug 2022 at 17:27, Animosity ***@***.***> wrote:

> That already exists as you can do --dry-run to see what will happen.
>
> If you re-run a sync, it does the whole remote every time as that's how
> sync works.
>
> A is mirrored to B.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6392#issuecomment-1222440503>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABV5MAD4ZAVTIPTFUEQRUCLV2OE6XANCNFSM57HQN6UQ>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

Sync is one direction. A-> B

If you an issue with something not doing what you'd expect, you'd want to share all the details for a bug report with a log file of the issue.

If you want to go two directions, check out -> https://rclone.org/bisync/

(bangs head against the wall).

It is as if my words are written in Swahili.

I know what the current range of operations can do and what they should do.
I am not asking for that.

Why would I WANT bisync (UNLESS I am missing something) as I DO NOT WANT TO
SYNC FROM A KNOWN "BAD DESTINATION" (e.g. has errors) into a nice clean
SOURCE.

I do not think I am writing in Swahili.

On Mon, 22 Aug 2022 at 17:45, Animosity ***@***.***> wrote:

> Sync is one direction. A-> B
>
> If you an issue with something not doing what you'd expect, you'd want to
> share all the details for a bug report with a log file of the issue.
>
> If you want to go two directions, check out -> https://rclone.org/bisync/
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6392#issuecomment-1222463429>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABV5MAEXIDWIJKMMJU6UD23V2OHALANCNFSM57HQN6UQ>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

The internet is always a great place as I'm volunteering my time and trying to figure out your question, help you out and you want to go with insulting me for trying to do that. 

Please raise your issue on the forums as someone else might help you out:

https://forum.rclone.org/

And I do likewise in other venues and based my response on my expectations
in return from when I help others. No need to play the martyr card or eject
teddy from the toybox. It is unbecoming.

I gave a fairly clear answer and it appears, for whatever reason (including
maybe you are answering within other acts) that you cannot, or do not,
understand, and have tried to propose a solution that seems [correct me if
I am wrong] incorrect for the situation.

Maybe the developer will in turn have some insight.

@ncw How do you open things wrongly closed...
You don't, go to the forum like you were told and ask for help there. People arent exactly the most accepting when they are being insulted.....

Err, feature request filed in feature request.

Perfectly reasonable to state when a correspondent does not seem to understand the problem and goes off in a tangent.

Mention of the forum was made when teddy was ejected. As for insults, that's laughable. 
 

—- 
Via iPad. Hopefully with not too many typos.
